title: Hidden Perspectives
excerpt: A digital archive gathering documents and events relating to the U.S. – Iran political relationship.
content:
Hidden Perspectives is a digital archive gathering a collection of documents procured via various sources by John Tirman, Malcolm Byrne and Hussein Banai to study the long and complex U.S. – Iran relationship.

The digital archive consists of 560 documents and a thousand event entries, dating from 1971 to 2012. Those have been summarized, enhanced with additional metadata and made accessible in an explorative visulization.

In this project, my role has been to coordinate the project and to design and develop the web application.

title: Getting a design job in 2030
excerpt: A critical-design timeline gathering real and speculative contents about the past and future of design jobs.
content:
This platform is the result of the seminar “Getting a Design Job in 2030 – Why design studies have to change and which skills are already helpful today to shape the future responsibly”.

The platform visualizes the temporal development of important topics for the design disciplines in the past and develops scenarios for the future of the work of designers.

In this project, my team's focus has been to design the user interface. While coordinating the design process, I developed the application using web technologies such as React or Redux.

title: Letterstori.es – Raoul Hausmann
excerpt: A visualization of the correspondence between the austrian dada artist Raoul Hausmann and his contemporaries.
content:
LetterStori.es is an interactive visualization that relates correspondence (letters, postcards , etc.) between different actors, and places them in a historical context.

Stories and thematic connections hidden across several documents in the collection are comprehensibly linked in curated “stories” which can be discovered and investigated.

My role in this project has been to coordinate the project, to design and to develop the web interface.

title: Streem - Retro-Future-Webdesign
excerpt: An experimental and fictional alternative online presence for the Berlin street magazine Streem.
content:
Streem is an urban and street magazine from Berlin that serves as a platform for artists of all kinds.

This website is the result of the seminar “Retro-Future-Webdesign” which constituted a framework to experiment with alternative ways to express ideas and to communicate content on the web.

Additionally to conceptualizing the idea, my role was to create illustrations and to develop the scroll-based web experiment.

title: Airbnb vs. Berlin
excerpt: A data journalism article analysing the impact of the housing platform Airbnb on Berlin.
content:
Airbnb vs. Berlin questions the impact of the growing popularity of the so-called “sharing economy” on the rise of the rents in Berlin.

This data journalism project analyses various aspects such as the price distribution, the terminologies used within the titles or the users with multiple offers to identify where the platform is used mainly professionally.

In this project, I processed, analysed and visualized data. I coauthored the article, created various communication materials and developed the website.

title: Hºme – Making heating is a breeze
excerpt: An app design concept for home heating control and schedule.
content:
Making heating a breeze. Such is the goal of Hºme, a mobile app designed to offer a convenient way to control and schedule home heating.

This project is the result of the seminar “Visual Interfaces basics”. In this course, we picked an existing interface and analysed its strengths and weaknessed and designed a more suited alternative.

After analysing my home thermostat device, I imagined an app that would allow the heating of my appartment to be controlled remotely and easily.

title: Collaboration app
excerpt: An app that helps digital workers to discuss problems and to find solutions collaboratively.
content:
This project is a result of the Seminar “Interface Design Basics” in which students were asked to design an iPhone app that uses the IOS8 components and respects the mobile operating system's graphical guidelines.

The app helps to finds solutions to existing demands. Projects are created by adding and describing existing problems, goals, proof tests, or the like. Then, alone or in team, solution proposals are created, which are compared and evaluated.

For this project, my role was to conceptualize the idea behind the app, to develop an experience for it and to design high-fidelity screens.

title: Bettina bummelt – Ebook for children
excerpt: An simplified and educational ebook that helps children to learn how to read.
content:
This project is a result of the Seminar “Interface Design Basics” in which students were asked to design an ebook as an exercise for bringing the paper format into the digital screen. The cultural, functional and aesthetical traditions of editorial design had to be married elegantly with the digital attributes and cababilities of a touch screen.

Bettina bummelt is a german book for children written by Elisabeth Shaw. It was selected for the exercise partly because of its simplicity but also for its very young public, which constituted an appealing design challenge.

title: Multi-generational living platform
excerpt: A communication and organisation platform for people linving in multi-generational communities.
content:
This platfrom for multi-generational living communities is the result of an interdisciplinary collaboration between students of different curriculums (Social services, product- and interfacedesign).

The intention is to support communities living in multi-generational projects by providing them with a tool for them to cummunicate, get organized and to promote their project to the public.

Together with my crew, my role has been to coordinate the design process, to research, ideate, conduct interviews and to design the portal.

title: Open Circle - Circular economy platform
excerpt: An online community web app for sharing circular economy-related know-how.
content:
This collaboration with the Agora Collective Berlin consisted in realising an online community web app that allows engaged people, collectives and enterprises to share circular economy-related know how.

The platform offers a place of exchange and proactive contribution in investigating creative ways to reuse waste and reduce its production. On Open Circle, communities can communicate, organise knowledge, inspire, lead by example and promote their project to raise funds.

In this project, my role has been to analyse the demands of the community, to structure the platform's content and to design the user interface.
